author: Special Correspondent
text:
The district police have cracked the double murder of All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam Nattarasankottai town panchayat ward councillor and his son in less than 24 hours by arresting seven of a 10-member gang.

Nagarajan (50), the 12th ward councillor, and his son Vignesh (21) were at home, when the gang members, armed with deadly weapons, barged into the house around 10.30 a.m. on Sunday and hacked them to death.

As intra-party rivalry was seen as the reason for the double murder, and Usha, wife of Nagarajan, identified some of the accused, the police formed special teams, and cracked the case quickly.

Those arrested included Ravi alias Ravichandran, who was Nattarasankottai town panchayat AIADMK secretary and removed from the party on Sunday night after the murder.

Kavi alias Kavi Raja, the main accused in the case, is absconding, and the police have zeroed in on Kanmani, another key accused in the case.

Nagarajan and Vignesh died on the spot and Usha, who came to their rescue, suffered cut injuries in her hands.
title: Double murder case cracked
